disclaimerData.disclaimer:
A Salicylic Peel is a chemical exfoliation procedure that employs salicylic acid, a beta hydroxy acid (BHA), to address acne, excess oil, and clogged pores. It functions by penetrating into the pores to dissolve oil and dead skin cells, helping to diminish breakouts and refine skin texture. Salicylic acid also possesses anti-inflammatory characteristics, making it particularly suitable for those with acne-prone or oily skin.

The process generally involves cleansing the skin, applying the salicylic acid solution for a designated time, and then neutralizing or removing it. The acid concentration can be adjusted based on the severity of the skin issue and the intended depth of exfoliation.

Risks involved in undergoing a Salicylic Peel include redness, dryness, temporary flaking, mild irritation, increased sun sensitivity, and in some instances, post-inflammatory darkening of the skin or an allergic response. Risks associated with declining treatment may include ongoing or worsening acne, persistent clogged pores, uneven skin texture, and excess oil production. Risks specific to my situation may include increased sensitivity or irritation depending on my skin type, any history of skin inflammation, or my current skincare routine.

The anticipated benefits of a Salicylic Peel include clearer pores, fewer acne blemishes, improved skin smoothness, reduced oiliness, and a more radiant overall appearance. Potential drawbacks include the possible need for multiple sessions for optimal results, a brief recovery period with potential peeling, and the requirement for strict sun protection.

Alternative options include other chemical peels (such as glycolic or lactic acid), microdermabrasion, laser therapies, prescription topical retinoids, or choosing no treatment. Each alternative carries its own set of benefits, limitations, and potential risks.

There are uncertainties regarding the extent of improvement, as outcomes depend on individual skin condition, peel strength, and compliance with aftercare instructions. Follow-up treatments may be necessary to sustain results or manage new breakouts.

Informed Consent and Photography
I confirm that I have been informed about all relevant aspects of this treatment and that I fully comprehend this advice. This includes information regarding:
- The reasons for undergoing a Salicylic Peel and the desired results
- The inherent risks of undergoing a Salicylic Peel
- The risks associated with declining a Salicylic Peel
- Any risks specific to my personal health and skin
- The anticipated benefits of the treatment
- Potential drawbacks or disadvantages
- Alternative treatments and their advantages and disadvantages, including the choice to have no treatment
- Any uncertainties and the probability of a successful outcome
- Any follow-up care that might be necessary

Clinical Photographs and Videos: I authorize the capture of clinical photographs and videos. I understand these images will become a part of my confidential medical file and will be stored accordingly.

I have been asked what details I require to make an informed choice and have had the chance to discuss my desired outcome thoroughly.

I certify that I have read this consent document and understand it completely. I have been provided sufficient opportunity for discussion, and all my questions have been answered to my satisfaction. No new information has emerged that alters my decision to undergo the procedure or to provide my consent. I hereby consent to the procedure. This document serves as the complete disclosure and replaces any prior verbal or written communications.

All deposits and booking fees are non-refundable unless otherwise agreed upon with the practitioner.

questions.content: Do you comprehend the details that have been given to you?
Do you believe enough information has been shared to allow you to give informed consent?
Have you given your consent voluntarily?
Are there any health issues you currently have?
Are you currently pregnant or nursing a child?
Do you suffer from a neuromuscular disorder (such as Multiple Sclerosis, ALS, motor neuropathy, myasthenia gravis, or Lambert-Eaton syndrome)?
Do you have an autoimmune condition?
Do you experience any skin problems?
Do you have any known allergies or a history of severe allergic reactions (anaphylaxis)?
Is there an active infection at the area where the procedure is planned?
Are you currently on any antibiotics or other prescribed medications?
Is there any other Medical or Social History we should be aware of? If yes, please explain in detail.
What are your goals and desired results for undergoing this procedure? Please elaborate.
Have you undergone this or a comparable treatment previously? If so, were there any issues? Please provide details.
Do you have any concerns? If so, please describe them.
Is there anything else we need to know? Please provide full information.
I will keep this information for the duration of my treatment and consult it as needed.
